intro: Orbeopsis caudata subsp. rhodesiaca, commonly known as the Rhodesian orbeopsis, is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red and purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
